title.value: PAC-Bayesian Generalization Bounds for Adversarial Generative Models
title.justification: This is the title as provided at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: PAC-Bayesian Generalization Bounds for Adversarial Generative Models

extractions.description: This paper extends PAC-Bayesian theory to generative models and develops generalization bounds for models based on the Wasserstein distance and the total variation distance. The authors provide new training objectives for Wasserstein GANs and Energy-Based GANs and perform numerical experiments showing non-vacuous generalization bounds for Wasserstein GANs on synthetic datasets.

type.justification: The paper primarily focuses on theoretical contributions, providing generalization bounds and extending PAC-Bayesian theory to generative models.
type.quote: Although our work is mainly theoretical, we perform numerical experiments showing non-vacuous generalization bounds for Wasserstein GANs on synthetic datasets.

name.justification: The paper focuses on theoretical aspects such as PAC-Bayesian bounds and generalization properties.
name.quote: We extend PAC-Bayesian theory to generative models... our work is mainly theoretical.

name.justification: The paper revolves around extending PAC-Bayesian theory to GANs and providing generalization bounds specifically for Wasserstein GANs and Energy-Based GANs.
name.quote: Our results naturally apply to Wasserstein GANs and Energy-Based GANs.

name.justification: The paper provides generalization bounds for Wasserstein GANs and performs experiments to show non-vacuous bounds.
name.quote: Our results naturally apply to Wasserstein GANs and Energy-Based GANs.

is_contributed.justification: Wasserstein GANs are not a new contribution of this paper; they are an existing model.
is_contributed.quote: Our results naturally apply to Wasserstein GANs and Energy-Based GANs.

is_executed.justification: The authors performed numerical experiments utilizing Wasserstein GANs.
is_executed.quote: we perform numerical experiments showing non-vacuous generalization bounds for Wasserstein GANs on synthetic datasets.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not primarily focus on comparing Wasserstein GANs with other models but rather on providing theoretical guarantees.
is_compared.quote: Although our work is mainly theoretical, we perform numerical experiments showing non-vacuous generalization bounds for Wasserstein GANs on synthetic datasets.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the reference paper where Wasserstein GANs were introduced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Arjovsky et al. (2017) introduce the Wasserstein GAN (WGAN)...

name.justification: The paper also develops bounds that apply to Energy-Based GANs and provides new training objectives for them.
name.quote: Our results naturally apply to Wasserstein GANs and Energy-Based GANs.

is_contributed.justification: Energy-Based GANs are not a new contribution of this paper; they are an existing model.
is_contributed.quote: Our results naturally apply to Wasserstein GANs and Energy-Based GANs.

is_executed.justification: The paper's experiments focused specifically on Wasserstein GANs, not Energy-Based GANs.
is_executed.quote: we perform numerical experiments showing non-vacuous generalization bounds for Wasserstein GANs on synthetic datasets.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not focus on comparing Energy-Based GANs with other models but rather on providing theoretical guarantees.
is_compared.quote: Our results naturally apply to Wasserstein GANs and Energy-Based GANs.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the reference paper where Energy-Based GANs were introduced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Another variant of GANs is the Energy-based GAN (Zhao et al., 2017), which views the critic as an energy function and uses a margin loss.
